  creation_place_original_location: Mahakam River Delta (Indonesia)

  shape: irregular

  techniques_name: carving (processes)

  object_colour: brown (colour)

  physical_appearance: This is a carved ossuary figure in a squatting position. Its palms are facing up and elbow resting on its kneecaps. The eye sockets are hollow and its teeth are bared.

  subject_terms_1: indigenous people  magic  ancestor worship  ossuaries (funerary containers) sculpture

  subject_terms_2: Fetishes (Ceremonial objects) Wood-carved figurines  Ossuaries  Ancestor worship  Protection magic  Figurative art Sculpture

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: This figure would have originally adorned the end of a bone box or ossuary used to carefully store the remains of revered ancestors. It was found hidden deep inside a cave.  It is probably meant to represent an ancestor
 a protecting spirit intended to frighten away thieves and evil spirits alike.  Ancestor figures carved in the form of a squatting man are found all over island Southeast Asia and are a common theme in the art of the Austronesian people.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This figure would have originally adorned the end of a bone box or ossuary used to carefully store the remains of revered ancestors. It was found hidden deep inside a cave.  It is probably meant to represent an ancestor, a protecting spirit intended to frighten away thieves and evil spirits alike.  Ancestor figures carved in the form of a squatting man are found all over island Southeast Asia and are a common theme in the art of the Austronesian people.
